casebody.data:
STATE of North Carolina
v.
Robert Stanley BROWN, Jr. No. 205P16 Supreme Court of North Carolina. September 22, 2016

Mr. Luther D. Starling, Jr., Mr. William Joel Starling, Jr., Attorneys at Law, For Brown, Robert Stanley (Jr.)

Ms. Lauren M. Clemmons, Special Deputy Attorney General, Mr. Ben R. David, District Attorney, For State of North Carolina *239ORDER

Upon consideration of the notice of appeal from the North Carolina Court of Appeals, filed by the Defendant-Appellant on the 24th of May 2016 in this matter pursuant to G.S. 7A-30, and the motion to dismiss the appeal for lack of substantial constitutional question filed by the @appellee, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals: the motion to dismiss the appeal is

"Allowed by order of the Court in conference, this the 22nd of September 2016."

Upon consideration of the petition filed on the 24th of May 2016 by Defendant in this matter for discretionary review of the decision of the North Carolina Court of Appeals pursuant to G.S. 7A-31, the following order was entered and is hereby certified to the North Carolina Court of Appeals:

"Denied by order of the Court in conference, this the 22nd of September 2016."
